definition: light cavalry/light motorcycle/moped
light/easy/gentle/soft/reckless/unimportant/frivolous/small in number/unstressed/neutral/to disparage
(Tw) saddle horse/mounted soldier
to sit astride/to ride (a horse, bike etc)/classifier for saddle horses

sentences.english: Akinjis, meaning 'raiders', are light cavalry serving in Muslim forces.
sentences.chinese: 阿金基意爲騎兵，是服役於穆斯林軍中的輕騎兵部隊。

sentences.english: The scooter goes much slower than the car at (the speed of ) 30 km an hour.
sentences.chinese: 輕騎的速度比小汽車慢的多，大約每小時30公里。

sentences.english: He moved his light horse toward Haldon's mountains.
sentences.chinese: 他將輕騎兵移向哈爾頓的山。

sentences.english: Tyrion moved up his heavy horse to support the light.
sentences.chinese: 提利昂讓他的重騎兵前去支持輕騎兵。

sentences.english: They are cute military performance troupe, their programs are highly welcomed by soldiers.
sentences.chinese: 她們是部隊裏的輕騎兵，表演的節目很受士兵們歡迎。

sentences.english: Men who follow Islam and fight for their faith on horseback.
sentences.chinese: 穆斯林輕騎兵爲信仰而戰，爲真主而戰。

definition: long-range raid
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
army camp

fight to the death/desperate struggle
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]

to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to transmit an order
to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
conclusion/judgment/verdict
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
Horizontal Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
